column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you must:
column6: pull over to the right and stop.
column8: drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
column10: stop as quickly as you can.

column2: 2. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 3. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column8: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column8: Hill or downgrade up ahead

column2: 5. This sign is a:
column8: stop sign.

column2: 6. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 7. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 8. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column6: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.
column8: signal your intentions ahead of time.

column2: 9. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column8: turn on your headlights only.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 10. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column8: It improves the vehicle stability.

column2: 11. This road sign is:
column8: a regulatory sign.

column2: 12. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column8: Never.

column2: 13. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 14. To enter a freeway:
column4: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column6: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column8: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column10: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.

column2: 15. You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
column4: wait for the owner to return.
column6: call your insurance company within 14 days.
column8: leave a note on the vehicle and report the accident with no delay.

column2: 16. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 17. When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
column8: lock the ignition and remove the ignition key.

column2: 18. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 19. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column6: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column8: the time of day.
column10: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.

column2: 20. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 22. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: less dangerous

column2: 23. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column8: toward the curb.

column2: 24. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 25. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column8: dangerous intersections.

column2: 26. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 27. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: wear approved helmets.

column2: 28. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 29. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: swing to the right side of your lane.
column8: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.

column2: 30. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column6: the entrance to a construction site.
column8: that you must not drive past this sign.
column10: the entrance to a dead-end street.

column2: 31. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column8: Slow down.

column2: 32. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you must stop again at the stop sign.
column6: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.
column8: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column10: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.

column2: 33. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column10: stop and wait for the light to change.

column2: 34. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
column8: Motorcyclists

column2: 35. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: be prepared to stop before the intersection.

column2: 36. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column6: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column8: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 37. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 38. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: slow down and keep moving in your lane.
column6: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column8: stop exactly where you are.
column10: pull to the curb and stop.

column2: 39. Parking is not allowed:
column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 40. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
column8: call the police.
